description: Installation of new shopfront including roller shutter and associated housing and re-positioning of entrance door
decision_conditions: REASON:  The proposed shopfront, due to its inappropriate and incongruous design and materials, would harm the character and appearance of the building and the as a result the wider conservation area. As such the proposal is considered to be contrary to policies 7.4 (Local character), 7.6 (Architecture) and 7.8 (Heritage assets and archaeology) of the London Plan 2011, policies D4 (Designing in context), D11 (Alterations and extensions), D13 (Shopfronts), D20 (Conservation areas) and D24 (Materials) of the Unitary Development Plan 2002, policies CS8 (Enhancing Islington’s character) and CS9 (Protecting and enhancing Islington’s built and historic environment) of the Core Strategy 2011, the Charterhouse Square Conservation Area Design Guidelines, the Shopfront Design Guide and policies DM1 (Design), DM3 (Heritage) and DM25 (Shopfronts) of the emerging Development Management Policies 2012.
